conversation.content: [hollow] El farero me dijo que llevas aquí, [wavering], dos años sin una sola visita, y no podía permitir que eso, [breaking], continuara sabiendo que estabas tan cerca de casa.
No deberías haber venido, eh, Sarah, porque o sea, [bitter], verte solo me recuerda todo lo que era antes, [cracking], la misión fracasó y se llevó a tres buenas personas con ella. [exhales sharply]

Pues, eh, ¿te crees que no sé, [frustrated], lo que es ver a alguien que amas, [trembling], desaparecer dentro de sí mismo? Porque o sea, [softer], llevo dos años viéndote desvanecer a través de los titulares de prensa.

[defensive] Los periódicos no saben lo que pasó allá arriba, [cold], no saben de los cálculos que fallé ni de las señales de alarma que, [haunted], ignoré porque estaba tan desesperado por ser el héroe que todos, [trailing off], esperaban que fuera.

[gentle] Nadie esperaba que fueras perfecto, [careful], ni mamá antes de morir, ni papá, y desde luego no, [emotional], yo que recuerdo cuando me enseñabas a navegar por las estrellas desde nuestro, [voice breaking], patio.

[struggling] Eh, pues, esas mismas estrellas que tanto amaba ahora solo, [heavy], me recuerdan la oscuridad que se tragó a mi tripulación mientras yo, eh, [choking], sobreviví en esa cápsula de escape como un cobarde.
[firm] Seguiste el protocolo, eh, y sabes, [steady], sobrevivir no te convierte en un cobarde, Michael.
[whispered] Para mí sí.
[desperate] La investigación te exoneró completamente, [pleading], e incluso las familias de tu tripulación han dicho públicamente que no te, [shaking], culpan por el fallo del equipo.
[raw] Su perdón lo hace, [anguished], peor de alguna manera porque yo no puedo perdonarme a mí mismo. [laughs bitterly]
Entonces déjame ayudarte, [vulnerable], como tú me ayudaste en cada crisis de mi vida antes de que, [reaching], decidieras castigarte en este exilio autoimpuesto.
O sea, eh, no es castigo, es, [resigned], protección para todos los demás de lo que me he convertido, pues, [hollow], solo una cáscara de astronauta que no pudo salvar a su equipo. [sighs heavily]
[fierce] Sigues siendo mi hermano, [determined], el que se quedó despierto toda la noche ayudándome con los deberes de física y que, [tender], me convenció de que era lo bastante listo para el MIT.
[broken] Eh, estaba equivocado.
[urgent] No, tenías razón sobre mí entonces, [passionate], y yo tengo razón sobre ti ahora cuando digo que mereces, [imploring], volver al mundo y dejar que la gente te quiera otra vez.
[barely audible] No puedo.
[soft] El servicio conmemorativo para tu tripulación es el mes que viene y sus familias, [careful], pidieron específicamente que hables tú.
[stunned] Pues, eh, ¿quieren que yo, [disbelieving], hable sobre la gente que no pude traer de vuelta a casa?
Quieren que tú, eh, o sea, [gentle], los honres como solo tú puedes hacerlo, como su comandante y amigo.
[yielding] No sé si soy, eh, [vulnerable], lo bastante fuerte para enfrentarme a ellos, Sarah, pero quizá, pues, quizá contigo allí, podría intentarlo.

original_conversation.content: [hollow] The lighthouse keeper told me you've been here, [wavering], two years without a single visitor, and I couldn't let that, [breaking], continue knowing you were this close to home.

You shouldn't have come, um, Sarah, because I mean, [bitter], seeing you just reminds me of everything I was before, [cracking], the mission failed and took three good people with it. [exhales sharply]

Well, um, you think I don't, [frustrated], know what it's like to watch someone I love, [trembling], disappear into themselves, because I mean, [softer], I've been watching you vanish for two years through newspaper headlines.

[defensive] The newspapers don't know what happened up there, [cold], they don't know about the calculations I missed or the warning signs I, [haunted], ignored because I was so desperate to be the hero everyone, [trailing off], expected me to be.

[gentle] Nobody expected you to be perfect, [careful], not mom before she died, not dad, and certainly not, [emotional], me who remembers when you taught me to navigate by the stars from our, [voice breaking], backyard.
[struggling] Um, well, those same stars I used to love now just, [heavy], remind me of the darkness that swallowed my crew while I, um, [choking], survived in that escape pod like a coward.
[firm] You followed protocol, um, and you know, [steady], surviving doesn't make you a coward, Michael.
[whispered] It does to me.
[desperate] The investigation cleared you completely, [pleading], and even the families of your crew have publicly said they don't, [shaking], blame you for the equipment failure.
[raw] Their forgiveness makes it, [anguished], worse somehow because I can't forgive myself. [laughs bitterly]
Then let me help you, [vulnerable], the way you helped me through every crisis in my life before you, [reaching], decided to punish yourself in this self-imposed exile.
I mean, um, it's not punishment, it's, [resigned], protection for everyone else from what I've become, well, [hollow], just a shell of an astronaut who couldn't save his team. [sighs heavily]
[fierce] You're still my brother, [determined], the one who stayed up all night helping me with physics homework and who, [tender], convinced me I was smart enough for MIT.
[broken] Um, I was wrong.
[urgent] No, you were right about me then, [passionate], and I'm right about you now when I say you deserve to, [imploring], come back to the world and let people love you again.
[barely audible] I can't.
[soft] The memorial service for your crew is next month and their families, [careful], specifically requested that you speak at it.
[stunned] Well, um, they want me to, [disbelieving], speak about the people I couldn't bring home?
They want you to, um, I mean, [gentle], honor them the way only you can, as their commander and friend.
[yielding] I don't know if I'm, um, [vulnerable], strong enough to face them, Sarah, but maybe, well, maybe with you there, I could try.

scenario: A sister visits her brother, a disgraced former astronaut who lost his crew in a failed mission, at the remote lighthouse where he's been living in isolation for two years.
